name: tempestuously
content:
tempestuously adverb
(WITH EMOTION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is full of strong emotions: "I owe you nothing!" she retorted tempestuously.
More examplesFewer examples Kym is tempestuously high-maintenance.So, we lived there together tempestuously. He must do so without the man with whom he has been so tempestuously and successfully partnered for so many years.Johann Strauss, who conducted the première of Der lustige Krieg on 25 November 1881, was applauded tempestuously after the playing of the overture.
